title: Dr. Oz on Vaccinations and Test Groups
description: Dr. Oz tells Jenny McCarthy that he doesn't believe in mandating vaccines and that the choice belongs to the parents.
cleaned_text: Dr. Oz on Vaccinations and Test Groups by SiriusXM Entertainment published on 2018-04-10T18:01:25Z Dr. Oz tells Jenny McCarthy that he doesn't believe in mandating vaccines and that the choice belongs to the parents. Comment by Michael West Dr Oz doesn't get it. Giving the Hep B shot to infants was NOT a "public health decision". It was purely a business decision. They were not able to get adult IV drug users to come in for the shot, so they figured giving to babies was a way to move product. 2018-04-14T00:49:41Z Comment by LoggieBear While I agree with some of Dr. Oz's points, he makes an error in suggesting that those who don't vaccinate would probably if it wasn't mandated. What this argument lacks is the understanding that parents who choose not to vaccinate have researched, and continue to, the effects of vaccines. They know and understand more than most healthcare professionals. So to say they would vaccinate if there wasn't so much push-back grossly underestimates the reasons for NOT vaccinating and makes non-vaccinating families
